meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of scientism.
meanings.sent1: Her scientistic approach to problem-solving always involved thorough research and analysis.
meanings.sent2: The professor's scientistic views influenced his research methodology.
meanings.sent3: The scientistic cat insisted on using a scientific method to catch a mouse.
meanings.sent4: His scientistic mindset was like a magnifying glass, focusing only on empirical evidence.
meanings.sent5: The scientistic concept of the universe was as clear as a bright star in the night sky.

meanings.definition: Excessively or dogmatically adhering to scientific methods or beliefs.
meanings.sent1: She was criticized for her scientistic approach to every aspect of life.
meanings.sent2: His scientistic attitude made him skeptical of anything not backed by scientific data.
meanings.sent3: The scientistic robot refused to believe in anything that couldn't be proven by science.
meanings.sent4: Her scientistic beliefs were like a shield, protecting her from any non-scientific ideas.
meanings.sent5: The scientistic mindset was as rigid as a steel beam, unwilling to bend to other perspectives.
